topic.title: Why the U.S. rich are not afraid to loose their wealth?

That is to say, the Government, even that of the North-Korea, does have to answer to the majority of the local elite. Even the North-Korean dictator has to have sufficient amount of supporters at the top of his party to kill any single one of the party members, as does the Syrian dictator Assad, as did the Iraqi Saddam Hussein, as did even the Stalin, but if the king/dictator threatens the well-being of the majority of the elite that it depends on for running the dictatorship/kingdom, which can include generals, top clergy, in some cases even some loyal academics, then it's a coup d'Ã©tat, which can happen in various ways, including with the help of a foreign military.

Interestingly the U.S. billionaires are not worried about loosing their wealth in a situation, where the Trump administration is totally out of control of the business elite. The Trump impeachment failed due to the protection by the Republican Party elite. Trump will likely win the 2020 elections, because the Democrats have a worn out establishment candidate, the "white colored" Joe Biden, who wants to point some policewomen or a prosecutor as his vice president at the midst of a wave of protests, where the main topic is Police Brutality towards the "black" and other "non-white" people. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YlR0B9KU3Uw&list=PLiZxWe0ejyv_3Osl8CLLc1M2N5CBSZFb-

The issue here is not so much the Trump, but the fact that the same scheme would work with anybody in the White House, just like it is kind of irrelevant, who is the person, who holds the title of the North-Korean dictator. It's the system that matters and the dictators and the elite that helps the dictator to run the "country" can nudge the system to the direction that they please. Not all the way, but a little bit, step by step. For example, part of the reason, why the Saudi-Arabia does not modernize fast enough is that the Saudi-Arabian dictator, the Sultan, relies on the Islamic Mullah as the clergy that runs the "country" and the Sultan can not just toss them aside. The Sultan can only try to replace individual Mullahs as long as the rest of the Mullah do not object at their private thoughts, but replacing them all at once is quite hard. 

Evolution is tough. In group evolution only the strongest groups survive. The more military strength and economic strength depends on smart people, the bigger the advantage of a dictatorship that can attract/tolerate the smartest people at its elite. Smart people do not need to be kind-hearted people, but they do need to be able to adhere to the rules of sharks: the moment sharks smell the blood of a shark, they disband, escape the scene. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernher_von_Braun

The Jew Albert Einstein had even a better "nose" and he escaped to the U.S. before the Nazi killing machine properly started. The Beijing China might not care about the Climate Change, but its leadership sure cares about clean air, which the fossil fuel based cars do not help to keep clean, not to mention that the Beijing China hates to depend on imported oil, as it reduces its autonomy. The major airlines buy the French Airbus, specially the gigantic Airbus 380, which directly competes with the Boeing 747. https://www.cs.vu.nl/~ast/intel/

When the U.S. becomes a religious, uneducated (people can't afford university level education or their religious parents won't let them attend atheistic universities), sick (the U.S. health care system) dump, the U.S. elite will live a lot like the North-Korean elite: wealthy in their own society, but quite poor if compared to other, free-er, societies. It took a while, till the successor of the Soviet Union, the Russia, was able to properly finance its space programs again.

On top of all of that mess there is the U.S. patent system. The open source movement and open hardware movement (the CPUs) have demonstrated that huge investments will be made even without using the patent system for financing the development work. The COVID19 vaccines are being frantically   developed globally without hoping to earn the development related expenses back trough any patent system, and yet, the U.S. corporations prefer to waste their money and time on patents and patent lawyers, giving the Russia and the China a clear advantage at their development programs. The Conservatives, who claim to respect private property, do not seem to understand that IDEAS ARE NOT PROPERTY and in stead of adopting new business models that allow fast reuse of ideas at product development and business, the "conservatives" want to limit the practical application of ideas by "protecting property", "protecting" "intellectual property". Even simulations can have a random number generator in use. Human behaviour might be partly random, like the behaviour of agents at agent oriented programming. On the other hand, it is relatively easy to figure out, whether one lives in a Matrix or not. Math holds regardless of what kind of fundamental physics laws, axioms in math sense, are used. If the human thinking is algorithmically more complex, requires more CPU-power, than the human brain cells jointly are able to deliver, then some of that thinking must be made somewhere outside of the human brain. That outside computational resource is the computer that executes the Matrix, the simulation. A counter-argument might be that may be some of the human thinking is done by using quantum computing and we are too stupid to know that our brains actually do some of the computations like that, but for that counter-argument to be true there must be actual, properly working, quantum computers available and as of 2020 the physicists have not been able to deliver any actual quantum computers, despite the lies and hype of the
https://www.dwavesys.com/quantum-computing
What the D-Wave fraudsters are selling is just a fancy old-school analog computer, which can be helpful in many cases, but probably not worth the price that they are asking for their product. 

The word "analog" in the "analog computer" comes from the idea that the computer contains some physical process that has mathematical properties similar to the problem being calculated and then the physical process at the box called analog computer is being measured and the measurement result is the approximate calculation result. A simple example of addition: pour one scaled down variable worth of water to a measuring glass and then pour another scaled down variable worth of water on  top of it and after that the value of the water-level in the measuring glass gives the approximate value of the sum of the scaled down variables.  In stead of messing with water the analog processes can be electrical. Hence the historic name of an electronic circuit: operational amplifier, "opamp" for short. Some old planes had mechanical analog calculators where the input parameters were the various air properties (pressure, temperature) and cargo weight. The cargo could be bombs. A mixed version is a table with values, like the books with values of logarithms. The "Babbage  Differential Engine"
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BlbQsKpq3Ak
was specifically designed for printing those books to avoid human errors. The Soviet Union space program used mostly analog computers as the control computers of their rockets, until they got the Buran space shuttle, a U.S. space shuttle Soviet clone, to run on logic circuits. The Buran was revolutionary in a sense that it was able to take off and land totally autonomously, something that none of the U.S. spacecraft was able to do and something that even the 2003 Iraq War era U.S. drones were still not able to do.

Architecturally a thing called "backend" does not make any sense with the ZeroNet. The ZeroNet model is copying/duplicating/redistributing composite documents like Microsoft Word files, except that in stead of a Microsoft Word file there is a folder that contains a backend-less HTML-zite with whatever files that a static home page with JavaScript browser-side GUI code might have.

The only point of a server side code in web applications is that it reads or stores something from the server or processes something on the server. If all users of a zite run their zite instance specific server side code, then the zite instances will all have a de facto separate versions and a queston arises, who's version other than the original author's version should be distributed to others. 

For short: a classical "backend" for ZeroNet is an oxymoron.

> [adrenochrome](#comment_13_19dzDaMFcuCusp4anMUPkVc8zRzLJmxo9T): Maybe you could save for example mysql files decentralized (sql scripts). It would be a static state of a database.

SQLite 
https://www.sqlite.org/
saves all of the data into a database instance specific file that is determined at the initialization of a database connection. SQLite is implemented as a C library. The PHP stdlib includes that C library, meaning, SQLite is supported by PHP by default without any database drivers. SQLite is supported by many, if not all, programming languages and an SQLite database size can be multiple GiB, although the SQLite file based approach is totally unsuitable for a situation, when a lot of threads tries to access the database at once, as is the case with web sites with lots of simultaneous visitors. The SQLite supports almost all of the standard SQL. That being said, a "back end" is still an oxymoron in the ZeroNet world. What might be done is that the browser side JavaScript might use 
https://github.com/emscripten-core/emscripten/wiki
to run a console application that is written in C and that console application might run the SQLite, which might read in the SQLite database, but that unnecessarily complicates things, because then the option might already be the use of the 
https://javascript.info/indexeddb
combined with the 
https://jsstore.net/

Basically, stop the nonsense and admit that sometimes You actually have to learn new things in stead of hoping to get by with a single old model everywhere. The world is changing. Not all change is worth following, but some changes actually are smart and worth following. I'm glad that nobody asked, how to run Windows10 on an 80-ties electronic watch.
